image_1.description: Grunnings is a firm that manufactures drills, where Mr. Dursley works as the director.
Mr. Dursley is the director of Grunnings, a firm that makes drills, and is married to Mrs. Dursley.
Mrs. Dursley is married to Mr. Dursley and is known for spying on the neighbors.
Dudley is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, and they believe there is no finer boy anywhere.
Privet Drive is the location where the Dursley family lives, and where strange occurrences begin to happen.
J.K. Rowling is the author of the story, with the book dedicated to specific individuals.
Jim Kay is the illustrator of the book, contributing art and animation to enhance the story.

image_2.description: A framed picture of the Dursley family, which includes Mr. Dursley with a large mustache, Mrs. Dursley with a wide smile, and their son Dudley, holding a crying baby which could symbolize their secret fear about the Potter family.
A small framed picture of a baby wearing a red hat with a sad expression, which might represent the hidden sadness or the unknown fate of Harry Potter, the son of the Potter family.

A small framed picture of a baby dressed in a bee costume with a neutral expression, possibly symbolizing the Dursleys' attempt to keep the existence of Harry Potter a secret and their normal life undisturbed.
A small framed picture of a baby wearing a green hat with a sad expression, which could represent the hidden sorrow or the concealed truth about the Potter family's son, Harry Potter.

image_3.description: Dudley Dursley is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Dursley, a small boy with a round face, wearing a blue hat, and often seen crying or having tantrums.
Vernon Dursley is the director of Grunnings, a firm that manufactures drills, and is known for his large mustache and often angry demeanor.
Grunnings is a firm that manufactures drills, where Mr. Dursley works as the director, and is associated with his normal routine.
Privet Drive is the location where the Dursley family lives, and where strange occurrences begin to happen, including the appearance of a tabby cat reading a map.
An envelope with an owl stamp and handwritten address, which is part of the mysterious events happening around the Dursley family.

image_4.description: A round sign with the text 'CHAPTER TWO THE VANISHING GLASS', a small spider located near the bottom, and surrounded by green foliage in the background.

image_5.description: An old, textured piece of parchment that the creature's hands are holding, which is reminiscent of the historical or ancient appearance fitting for a story setting, similar to the mysterious letter Harry receives.

The main character who receives a mysterious letter and is a student at Stonewall High, also addressed as Mr. H. Potter in the letter, and is known for his encounters with strange strangers and his difficult family life with the Dursleys.

image_6.merged_entity_name: CHAPTER FOUR: THE KEEPER OF THE KEYS
image_6.description: The title of the chapter, indicating the beginning of a new section in the narrative, which introduces Rubeus Hagrid, the Keeper of Keys at Hogwarts, who brings Harry a birthday cake and plays a significant role in the story.
Various keys depicted in the image, symbolizing access or secrets, which are related to Rubeus Hagrid's role as the Keeper of Keys at Hogwarts.

image_7.description: Vernon Dursley, also known as Uncle Vernon, is a character who is actively trying to avoid going home and leads the family to various locations before ending up on a rock in the sea. He is Harry's uncle who tries to prevent Harry from receiving letters by various means, including tearing them up and boarding up the mail slot.

Harry Potter, also known as Harry or Mr. H. Potter, is the main character who receives a mysterious letter and is a student at Stonewall High. He is also addressed as Mr. H. Potter in the letter and is contemplating his upcoming eleventh birthday while waiting for the storm to pass.

Petunia Dursley, also known as Aunt Petunia, is Harry's aunt and Vernon's wife, who is involved in the attempts to stop the letters from reaching Harry. She timidly suggests going home and is involved in the family's journey to the rock.

Dudley Dursley is the son of Vernon and Petunia, and Harry's cousin, who is also involved in the family's escape to avoid the letters. He is concerned about missing television and is part of the family's journey to the rock.

image_8.description: Hagrid is a large man with a long beard and wild hair, wearing a green coat and holding a pink umbrella, known for his involvement in the wizarding world, his sadness and respect towards Harry, and his role as the gamekeeper at Hogwarts after being expelled.
A blue and white striped couch on which Hagrid is lying, as described in the context of Hagrid's visit to Harry.
An open book titled 'Chapter Five: Diagon Alley' resting on Hagrid's chest, which is a significant part of Harry's introduction to the wizarding world.
Harry Potter is the main character who discovers he is a wizard, destined to attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and is known for his survival of the killing curse.

Albus Dumbledore is the highly respected headmaster of Hogwarts, considered one of the greatest wizards, who allowed Hagrid to stay on as gamekeeper after his expulsion and is a significant figure in Harry's journey.
Vernon Dursley is Harry's uncle, who is hostile and dismissive towards the wizarding world and Harry's parents, and is adamant about not allowing Harry to go to Hogwarts.
Dudley is Harry's cousin, who often physically abuses him, and is turned into a pig-like creature by Hagrid as a punishment for his bullying.
Hogwarts is the school of witchcraft and wizardry where Harry's parents were head boy and girl, indicating their prominence, and is known for being the best in the world.
